data.title: Fix $msCompile regex to match Microsoft C++ Compiler messages
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1

The fix is rather trivial: in `problemMatcher.ts` replace `msCompile` regex

```
/^([^\s].*)\((\d+|\d+,\d+|\d+,\d+,\d+,\d+)\):\s+(error|warning|info)\s+(\w{1,2}\d+)\s*:\s*(.*)$/
```

with

```
/^([^\s].*)\((\d+|\d+,\d+|\d+,\d+,\d+,\d+)\)\s*:\s+(error|warning|info)\s+(\w{1,2}\d+)\s*:\s*(.*)$/
```

BTW, what predefined pattern is expected to be used with MSVC compiler? `msComplie` or `cpp`? If the latter, `cpp` regex should fixed instead.

data.title: Monotype font is not used when set.
data.body:
I cannot set my code font to Monotype in VSC. Both sublime text and Google Chrome render Monotype well.

![Monotype](http://i.imgur.com/GoxoZOt.png) 
- VSCode Version:
  Version 1.2.1
  Commit fe7f407b95b7f78405846188259504b34ef72761
  Date 2016-06-14T12:54:38.105Z
  Shell 0.37.6
  Renderer 49.0.2623.75
  Node 5.10.0
- OS Version:
  Xubuntu  (Ubuntu 16.04 LTS)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add this in your setting 

``` json
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
    "editor.fontFamily": "monospace",
    "editor.fontSize": 16
}
```
1. Restart VSC just in case
2. Check the code rendered font

data.title: Use original-fs instead of manually ignoring ASAR files
Autofetch should be disable by default
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0
- OS Version: any

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder in VSCode that is a git repository.
2. The git repository is modified without prompting the user (a fetch is performed).

I propose that VSCode should have the `git.autofetch` configuration flag set to `false` by default.  It seems quite unusual that an editor would immediately start modifying a folder simply because it has been opened.  This seems like incorrect default behaviour.  This default behaviour does not exist in any git client that I am aware of.  Fetching is an operation that needs to be done and occasionally may be problematic.

This appears to have led to a few issues (with a quick search):
- #2595 (mystery Dropbox updates)
- #7821 and #7944 (same issue: repeated dialogs)
- #7409 and #987 (random git locking likely due to fetching in the background)

data.title: Uri.with() allows adding colon to scheme
data.body:
Testing #8192 
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (d0c2b891903d73e83dcdc7786398ebfa764fc4ee, 2016-06-28T05:04:06.083Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. vscode.Uri.parse("scheme://authority/path/?param=value#fragment").with({ scheme: "sche:me" }).toString()
   => "sche:me://authority/path/?param%3Dvalue#fragment"
2. Throwing an error in such cases would catch errors earlier.

data.title: Add API to parse/update Uri.query
data.body:
Testing #8192

Currently Uri.query needs to be parsed and updated through Uri.with() by the extension author. It would be nice to offer API doing that.

data.title: Uri.toString() encodes '=' in query
data.body:
Testing #8192 
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (d0c2b891903d73e83dcdc7786398ebfa764fc4ee, 2016-06-28T05:04:06.083Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. vscode.Uri.parse("scheme://authority/path/?param=value#fragment").toString()
   => "scheme://authority/path/?param%3Dvalue#fragment"
2. The percent encoding of '=' is unexpected.

data.title: Uri.with: Cannot remove authority
data.body:
Testing #8192 
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (d0c2b891903d73e83dcdc7786398ebfa764fc4ee, 2016-06-28T05:04:06.083Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I can add an authority: vscode.Uri.parse("scheme:/path").with({ authority: "authority" }).toString()
   => "scheme://authority/path"
2. But I cannot remove it: vscode.Uri.parse("scheme:/path").with({ authority: "authority" }).with({ authority: "" }).toString()
   => "scheme://authority/path"

data.title: Integrated terminal: Title bar should pass focus to text area
data.body:
When testing #8222 
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (d0c2b891903d73e83dcdc7786398ebfa764fc4ee, 2016-06-28T05:04:06.083Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. When terminal is shown, click on its title bar 'TERMINAL'.
2. -> The focus is not passed to the terminal's text area, which seems like to only possible intent of the click.

data.title: Integrated terminal: Combine "toggle" and "focus" commands
data.body:
Testing #8222 
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (d0c2b891903d73e83dcdc7786398ebfa764fc4ee, 2016-06-28T05:04:06.083Z)

Currently I need two keyboard shortcuts to do all three:
- show and focus terminal when not already shown ("toggle" or "focus")
- focus terminal when already shown ("focus")
- hide terminal when shown ("toggle")

This could be simplified by letting the "toggle" command focus the terminal when already shown but not in focus. It would then hide the terminal only when already focused.

data.title: Suggestion: Use different icons for Extension View popular and recommended buttons
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0-insiders
- OS Version:Windows 7

The flame icon for popular is confusing with the OmniSharp flame and perhaps offensive ("hot").  The gift icon is difficult to see and understand.

Suggestion: Use a star icon for popular.  This matches the star ratings we show in the extension items.

Suggestion: Use a thumbs up hand image for recommended.  The thumbs up image is very popular on GitHub and easily understood.

data.title: Autoformat not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (d0c2b891903d73e83dcdc7786398ebfa764fc4ee, 2016-06-28T05:04:06.083Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:
In workspace and user settings:
1. Set `"editor.tabSize": 4`
2. Set `"editor.detectIndentation": false,`
3. Autoformat javascript code (Alt+F)

Will format code with 2 spaces and remove semicolons. It was not happening in last release.

data.title: Monaco: JSON format replaces space with tab indentation
data.body:
Testing #8210 
- Monaco Version: 0.5.3
- Browser Version: Safari 9.1.1

Not sure if this is just "as designed".

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open JSON file with only spaces as indentation
2. Format -> spaces are replaced with tabs

data.title: 'tab' key stopped working in json file; moves focus away from editor
data.body:
Platform: OS X

I was editing a launch.json file when suddenly the tab key stopped working. Instead of inserting a 'tab' character (and indenting a json line) it was moving focus away from the editor.

Sorry, but I don't have better steps.

@aeschli you saw the same, right?

data.title: Linux: VS Code needs to be restarted before Emmet preferences take effect
data.body:
#8207
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (d0c2b891903d73e83dcdc7786398ebfa764fc4ee, 2016-06-28T05:01:27.563Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-24-generic, Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add to settings:
   
   ``` json
   "emmet.syntaxProfiles": {
     "html": {
       "attr_case": "upper"
     }
   }
   ```
2. Open HTML editor
3. Type `.foo` and press <kbd>tab</kbd> to expand, the setting doesn't apply
4. Reload the window and repeat 2-3, the setting doesn't apply

I needed to do a full restart to get the settings to take effect.

data.title: [json] Error on empty line not visible in text area
data.body:

- Monaco Version: 0.5.3

Steps to Reproduce:

2. Remove last ] or }
3. Let the file end with an empty line
4. -> An error is indicated in the overview ruler, but not in the editor
